str2: Of time: when, now, after that; of cause: seeing that, forasmuch as. From epei and de; since now, i.e. when, or whereas.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From epi and potheo; to dote upon, i.e. Intensely crave possession.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To feel fear, lack courage, be distressed, troubled. From a derivative of adeo; to be in distress.
On this account, because, for. From dia and hoti; on the very account that, or inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be weak (physically: then morally), To be sick. From asthenes; to be feeble.
